title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement [INSERT CONTACT METHOD]. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.0, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/ code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https:// www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to sims
text: outlines propose change sims.

title: Contributing to sims
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to sims
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to sims
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to sims
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to sims
text: Please note sims project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help with sims
text: Thanks using sims! filing issue, places explore pieces put together make process smooth possible.

title: Getting help with sims
text: opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

title: Getting help with sims
text: Start making minimal reproducible example using reprex package. haven’t heard used reprex , ’re treat! Seriously, reprex make R-question-asking endeavors easier (pretty insane ROI five ten minutes ’ll take learn ’s ). additional reprex pointers, check Get help! section tidyverse site.

title: Get Started with sims
text: default, sims_simulate() returns simulated datasets form nlists object.
code: library(sims) set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", nsims = 2L) #> $a #> [1] 0.2213763 #>  #> an nlists object of 2 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element

title: Get Started with sims
text: , however, save = TRUE nlist object saved .rds file path.
code: set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", nsims = 2L, save = TRUE, path = tempdir(), exists = NA) #> [1] TRUE sims_data_files(tempdir()) #> [1] "data0000001.rds" "data0000002.rds"

title: Get Started with sims
text: datasets .rds files can imported nlists object using sims_data().
code: sims_data(tempdir()) #> $a #> [1] 0.2213763 #>  #> an nlists object of 2 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element

title: Get Started with sims
text: values including .Random.seed (printed) used generate datasets saved .sims_args.rds can imported using sims_info(). fact arguments sims_simulate() saved file allows additional .rds datasets generated using sims_add().
code: sims_info(tempdir())[1:5] #> $code #> [1] "a <- runif(1)" #>  #> $constants #> an nlist object with 0 numeric elements #>  #> $parameters #> an nlist object with 0 numeric elements #>  #> $monitor #> [1] "a" #>  #> $nsims #> [1] 2 sims_add(tempdir(), nsims = 3L) #> [1] "data0000003.rds" "data0000004.rds" "data0000005.rds" sims_data_files(tempdir()) #> [1] "data0000001.rds" "data0000002.rds" "data0000003.rds" "data0000004.rds" #> [5] "data0000005.rds"

title: Get Started with sims
text: user wishes duplicate datasets can either regenerate specifying different path seed (using set.seed()). Alternatively, can copy existing .sims.rds datasets files new directory using sims_copy()
code: sims_copy(path_from = tempdir(), path_to = paste0(tempdir(), "_copy")) #> [1] "data0000001.rds" "data0000002.rds" "data0000003.rds" "data0000004.rds" #> [5] "data0000005.rds"

title: Get Started with sims
text: user can check datasets specified .sims.rds present using sims_check().
code: sims_check(path = paste0(tempdir(), "_copy")) file.remove(file.path(paste0(tempdir(), "_copy"), "data0000005.rds")) #> [1] TRUE  sims_check(path = paste0(tempdir(), "_copy")) #> Error: #> ! Number of data files (4) does not match number of simulations (5).

title: Get Started with sims
text: Parallelization implemented using future package. use available cores local machine simply execute following code calling sims_simulate().
code: library(future) plan(multisession) set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", nsims = 2L) #> $a #> [1] 0.2213763 #>  #> an nlists object of 2 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element

title: Get Started with sims
text: Progress reported using progressr package follows.
code: library(progressr) with_progress(sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", nsims = 1000L)) #> $a #> [1] 0.5248719 #>  #> an nlists object of 1000 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Beliveau , Thorley J (2024). sims: Simulate Data R 'JAGS' Code. R package version 0.0.4, https://poissonconsulting.github.io/sims/, https://github.com/poissonconsulting/sims.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sims: Simulate Data from R or 'JAGS' Code},   author = {Audrey Beliveau and Joe Thorley},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.4, https://poissonconsulting.github.io/sims/},   url = {https://github.com/poissonconsulting/sims}, }

what: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
title: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
text: sims R package generate datasets R JAGS code use simulation studies. datasets returned nlists object /saved file individual .rds files. Parallelization implemented using future package. Progress reported using progressr package.

title: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
text: can install released version sims CRAN : development version GitHub :
code: install.packages("sims") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("poissonconsulting/sims")

title: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
text: default, sims_simulate() returns simulated datasets form nlists object. , however, save = TRUE nlist object saved .rds file path.
code: library(sims) set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", nsims = 2L) #> $a #> [1] 0.2213763 #>  #> an nlists object of 2 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", nsims = 2L, save = TRUE, path = tempdir(), exists = NA) #> [1] TRUE sims_data_files(tempdir()) #> [1] "data0000001.rds" "data0000002.rds" sims_data(tempdir()) #> $a #> [1] 0.2213763 #>  #> an nlists object of 2 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element

title: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
text: information see Get Started vignette.

title: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
text: Please report issues. Pull requests always welcome.

title: Simulate Data from R or JAGS Code
text: Please note sims project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Parameters for sims functions — params
text: Descriptions parameters sims functions.

title: Parameters for sims functions — params
text: path string path directory simulated data. path_from string path directory containing simulated datasets. path_to string path directory copy simulated dataset . code string JAGS R code generate data. JAGS code must data model block. constants nlist object (list can coerced nlist) specifying values nodes code. values included output dataset. parameters nlist object (list can coerced nlist) specifying values nodes code. values included output dataset. monitor character vector (regular expression string) specifying names nodes code include dataset. default nodes included. stochastic logical scalar specifying whether monitor deterministic stochastic (NA), deterministic (FALSE) stochastic nodes (TRUE). latent logical scalar specifying whether monitor observed latent (NA), latent (TRUE) observed nodes (FALSE). nsims whole number 1 1,000,000 specifying number data sets simulate. default 1 data set simulated. save flag specifying whether return data sets nlists object save path. save = NA datasets returned nlists object saved path. exists flag specifying whether path directory already exist (exists = NA matter). rdists character vector specifying R functions recognize stochastic. ask flag specifying whether ask deleting sims compatible files. silent flag specifying whether suppress warnings.

title: Copy Simulated Datasets — sims_copy
code: sims_copy(   path_from = ".",   path_to = paste0(path_from, "_copy"),   exists = FALSE,   ask = getOption("sims.ask", TRUE),   silent = FALSE )

title: Copy Simulated Datasets — sims_copy
text: path_from string path directory containing simulated datasets. path_to string path directory copy simulated dataset . exists flag specifying whether path_to already exist. exists = NA matter. directory already exists sims compatible files deleted exists = TRUE exists = NA otherwise error thrown. ask flag specifying whether ask deleting files. silent flag specifying whether suppress warnings.

title: Copy Simulated Datasets — sims_copy
text: character vector names files copied.

title: Simulated Datasets — sims_data
text: Gets simulated datasets nlist::nlists_object(). guarantee datasets fit memory.

title: Simulated Datasets — sims_data
code: sims_data(path = ".")

title: Simulated Datasets — sims_data
text: path string path directory simulated data.

title: Simulated Datasets — sims_data
text: nlist::nlists_object() simulated datasets.

title: Simulated Datasets — sims_data
code: set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)",   nsims = 10L, path = tempdir(),   exists = NA, ask = FALSE ) #> $a #> [1] 0.3068346 #>  #> an nlists object of 10 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element library(nlist) sims_data(tempdir()) #> $a #> [1] 0.2909775 #>  #> an nlists object of an nlist object with 1 numeric element

code: set.seed(10) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)",   nsims = 10L, path = tempdir(),   exists = NA, ask = FALSE ) #> $a #> [1] 0.3068346 #>  #> an nlists object of 10 nlist objects each with 1 numeric element sims_data_files(tempdir()) #> [1] "data0000001.rds"

title: Sims Random R Distributions — sims_rdists
code: sims_rdists() #>  [1] "rbeta"     "rbinom"    "rcauchy"   "rchisq"    "rexp"      "rf"        #>  [7] "rgamma"    "rgeom"     "rhyper"    "rlnorm"    "rmultinom" "rnbinom"   #> [13] "rnorm"     "rpois"     "rsignrank" "rt"        "runif"     "rweibull"  #> [19] "rwilcox"

title: Simulate Datasets — sims_simulate
text: Simulates datasets using JAGS R code. default returns datasets nlist::nlists_object(). path provided datasets written directory individual .rds files.

title: Simulate Datasets — sims_simulate
code: sims_simulate(   code,   constants = nlist::nlist(),   parameters = nlist::nlist(),   monitor = ".*",   stochastic = NA,   latent = NA,   nsims = 1,   save = FALSE,   path = ".",   exists = FALSE,   rdists = sims_rdists(),   ask = getOption("sims.ask", TRUE),   silent = FALSE )

title: Simulate Datasets — sims_simulate
text: code string JAGS R code generate data. JAGS code must data model block. constants nlist object (list can coerced nlist) specifying values nodes code. values included output dataset. parameters nlist object (list can coerced nlist) specifying values nodes code. values included output dataset. monitor character vector (regular expression string) specifying names nodes code include dataset. default nodes included. stochastic logical scalar specifying whether monitor deterministic stochastic (NA), deterministic (FALSE) stochastic nodes (TRUE). latent logical scalar specifying whether monitor observed latent (NA), latent (TRUE) observed nodes (FALSE). nsims whole number 1 1,000,000 specifying number data sets simulate. default 1 data set simulated. save flag specifying whether return data sets nlists object save path. save = NA datasets returned nlists object saved path. path string specifying path directory save data sets . exists flag specifying whether path directory already exist (exists = NA matter). rdists character vector specifying R functions recognize stochastic. ask flag specifying whether ask deleting sims compatible files. silent flag specifying whether suppress warnings.

title: Simulate Datasets — sims_simulate
text: default nlist::nlists_object() simulated data. Otherwise path defined saves datasets individual .rds files returns TRUE.

title: Simulate Datasets — sims_simulate
text: JAGS code identified presence '~' indicating stochastic variable node. Otherwise code assumed R code stochastic variable nodes assignment immediately succeeded call one functions named rdists. constants parameters must [nlist::nlist_object]s (lists can coerced ) . difference constants parameters values constants appended output data values parameters . Neither constants parameters can include missing values can elements name. Elements code dropped warning (unless silent = TRUE case warning suppressed). set simulated data set written separate .rds file. files labelled data0000001.rds, data0000002.rds, data0000003.rds etc. argument values saved hidden file .sims.rds. sims compatible files matching regular expression ^((data\\\\d\{7,7\})|([.]sims))[.]rds$. Parallelization implemented using future package.

title: Simulate Datasets — sims_simulate
code: set.seed(101) sims_simulate("a <- runif(1)", path = tempdir(), exists = NA, ask = FALSE) #> $a #> [1] 0.6373621 #>  #> an nlists object of an nlist object with 1 numeric element
